title: 105_hr2718
content: The "Taxpayer Relief and Protection Act of 1997" is a legislation that aims to reduce income tax rates for noncorporate taxpayers. The "Taxpayer Relief and Protection Act of 1997" reduces income tax rates for noncorporate taxpayers by amending various tables and subsections in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Key changes include lowering tax rates from 15% to 14.25%, 28% to 26.6%, 31% to 29.45%, 36% to 34.2%, and 39.6% to 37.62%. Maximum capital gains rates are also adjusted, with rates like 28% being changed to 26.6% and 25% to 23.75%. The Taxpayer Relief and Protection Act of 1997 reduces income tax rates for noncorporate taxpayers by amending various tables and subsections in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The changes include lowering tax rates to 14.25%, 26.6%, 29.45%, 34.2%, and 37.62%. Additionally, the alternative minimum tax rates are adjusted to 24.7% and 26.6%. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1997, with a tax rate of 26.6 percent. SEC. 3 amends the standard deduction in the Internal Revenue Code to be twice that of a single return, effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 1997. SEC. 4 changes the filing date for individual income tax returns to November 1. Section 6072(a) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change the filing date for income tax returns from April 15th to November 1st. This change also affects the filing date for gift tax returns. Section 6501(b)(2) and 6513 of the Internal Revenue Code are amended to change the filing dates for certain taxes from April 15th to November 1st. Additionally, Section 6621(b)(2) is amended regarding special rules for individual estimated tax. The Federal short-term rate for individual estimated tax is amended to apply in the first calendar quarter after the month it is determined. The period of underpayment is changed from the 15th day of the 4th month to the 1st day of the 11th month. These amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1997.
